entry.title: [ SavedTabGroup ] Fix drop indicator bug / Fix separator bug
entry.content:
Fixes a bug where the drop indicator would not be visible when attempting to drag a group to the end of the container when there was 4 or less buttons present. This is done by reserving 8px in SavedTabGroupBar so the drop indicator has room to paint. To account for this, the BookmarkBar is losing 8px, specifically on the SavedTabGroup separator.



Fixes a bug where the separator between the SavedTabGroupBar section and BookmarksBar section would not appear when the browser was resized to a smaller size.



Bug: 1474648

entry.title: Revert "device_settings_policy: Add device policy for switching function keys"
entry.content:
This reverts commit cf1926f2a1b428b7d38eb93aef601c2d25831fa4.



Reason for revert: This fails chromium/ci/linux-presubmit with the following reason: Please add 'DeviceSwitchFunctionKeysBehaviorEnabled' to device_policy_proto_map.yaml and map it to the corresponding field in chrome_device_policy.proto.



Original change's description:

> device_settings_policy: Add device policy for switching function keys

>

> This CL adds a new device policy called

> "DeviceSwitchFunctionKeysBehaviorEnabled".

>

> See c/p/r/t/p/M/DeviceSwitchFunctionKeysBehaviorEnabled.yaml in this

> CL for a full definition of the policy.

>

> About half of this CL adds the policy, following the instructions at

> https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/enterprise/add_new_policy.md.

> The other half of this CL implements the policy, which controls the

> behavior of the setting titled "Use the launcher key to change the

> behavior of function keys".

>

> Screenshots:

> Policy true: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/twYSXaMb5a8kTTf

> Policy false: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3HKJpTUuXKHLUUQ

> Policy unset: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/B6ZjHXKeNEhfHPn

>

> Test: ash_unittests -f=*InputDeviceSettingsPolicyHandlerTest*

> Test: components_unittests -f="*ConfigurationPolicyHandlerListTest*"

> Test: browser_tests -f *PolicyPrefsTest.PolicyToPrefsMapping*

> Test: ash_unittests -f=*KeyboardPrefHandler*

entry.title: Minor fix for independent damage on quads sharing quad state
entry.content:
Surface damage in Exo is separated into each texture quad via the

'per_quad_damage' feature. However these quads can all completely

overlay and therefor can share a single 'shared_quad_state'.

Surface aggregator did not expect to have 'per_quad_damage' for a

quad that also shared the same sqs. This minor fix allows for that

condition and appends this additional independent damage to the

'surface_damage_rect_list'.



Bug: b/296293066,1482361

Change-Id: I53d1339e52c8f7e29023ae81fe4229c12dfefd2c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4858982

Commit-Queue: Peter McNeeley

Reviewed-by: Kevin Haslett

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1196368}

and allows us to avoid explicitly zeroing.

entry.title: Remove redundant checks for AnchorElementMetricsSender availability
entry.content:
Call sites which lookup an AnchorElementMetricsSender first check whether

a given document may have the sender before calling the lookup method,

but the lookup method also does the availability check.



As observed in issue 1481259, one of these call sites is on a hot path.

So even though the check is no longer individually expensive, the

redundant checks would still have a measurable effect.



Bug: 1481259

entry.title: Highlight the current sentence.
entry.content:
This includes fading out what's already been read and brightly

highlighting the current sentence. I needed to go by tree node because

we need access to the node to add spans for highlighting. This makes the

speech very choppy on places like Wikipedia that has lots of links

everywhere (since each link is a separate node), but I put a TODO to

investigate how to make that better. The highlight itself also only

highlights the single node even if it's less than a sentence. But it's a

good start.



demo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1N2apDSnfZJfKorf7Kl6WsAzdQ7uII98J/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-VkCacO_SbK-aQsdzxd1SKQ

entry.title: [Element Capture #5] fix coordinate system issues
entry.content:
This Patch:



This patch fixes several related issues caused by mismatches

in coordinate systems, of which capture is concerned with several:



A: the compositor frame or root render pass coordinate system



This coordinate system is rooted at 0,0 and has a size of frame_size.



B: the captured render pass coordinate system



When we are not capturing the root render pass, this coordinate

system is independent, and linked to A through the use of a transform.



C: the root aura::Window coordinate system



For ChromeOS window capture, this is the same as A. For tab capture, this is the coordinate system of the entire Chrome browser.



D: the aura::Window under capture coordinate system



This is used by the mouse cursor overlay to determine where the cursor is drawn. Calculation on all platforms is done by taking the coordinates from the operating system in the reference space of a targeted window and then normalizing the location to be mapped to B.



E: the operating system mouse cursor location coordinate system



This gets transformed to a normalized vector and inputted into the overlay calculations.



F: the output video frame coordinate system



The captured video frame has its own coordinate system, which accounts for things like letterboxing and scaling.



Resolved Issues:



1. The mouse cursor position is drawn incorrectly. This is resolved by ensuring that the normalized bounds from E get properly translated into the output video frame system F.



2. Elements that have a render pass with negative bounds do not get captured at all. This is resolved by properly translating the coordinated from system B to system A when necessary, and no longer assuming that the render pass is rooted at 0, 0.



The Project:

For more information, Googlers may visit: go/element-capture



All developers are welcome to visit the W3 spec page at:

https://screen-share.github.io/element-capture/



Coming Up Next:

* Bug fixing and stabilizations.

* Working with eladlon@ to replace the hack with the proper

restrictTo API.



Bug: 1418194,1287686

entry.content:
There is a plan to move image-decoders to components/.



ImageDecoder CalculateMaxDecodedBytes() needs the MaxDecodedImageBytes

information from platform. In order to separate the ImageDecoder

component BUILD from the platform BUILD, the platform code will be

moved outside of ImageDecoder. The caller of ImageDecoder::Create()

needs to get the info from Platform::Current()->MaxDecodedImageBytes()

and pass it in.

entry.title: Record the possible submitted types after the form uploads votes
entry.content:
We are working on improving the UKM recording of Autofill and better

understand the Autofill performance from the UKM events.



This CL is working on adding the log event for possible submitted

types by comparing the value in the field with what is stored in

users' profile at the form submission time when we start uploading the

votes to autofill server.

entry.title: Fix window enumeration/offline integration tests to match/wait correctly
entry.content:
Fixed:

* The offline install test case now takes into account the new Installer

API behavior that successful interactive installs show a progress UI,

but once the install completes, the `InstallerSuccessLaunchCmdLine` is

launched and the UI closes automatically.

* The offline install test case now robustly handles waiting for the

unsuccessful interactive install error dialog.

* `CloseInstallCompleteDialog` was not waiting for a match, resulting

in incorrect semantics.

* `CloseInstallCompleteDialog` now exits early if a match was found.

* `WindowEnumerator` stops enumeration early if a match was found.

* Removed the need to call `::WaitForInputIdle` in `Run`.



The `mac-updater-try-builder-rel` and the `mac-updater-try-builder-dbg`

bots have been in a `shard #0 expired, not enough capacity` state for

almost 6 hours now. My change is Windows only, so I'm bypassing these

bots with `No-Try: true`



No-Try: true

Bug: 1286574,1481314

entry.title: Add InstallableCriteria to InstallableEvaluator
entry.content:
This is to support universal install (install any site) - when a field

that is required for install is not provided by manifest, we fallback

to use web page metadata.

This CL adds an enum to the InstallableEvaluator's check, and update

the |CheckManifestValid| to either 1) not run, 2) check valid manifest

same as before, 3) check if the fallback value is available.

entry.title: Restore offscreen canvas context with the right resource provider
entry.content:
The OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D class creates its resource

provider by calling OffscreenCanvas::GetOrCreateResourceProvider().

The method TryRestoreContextEvent however was using

CanvasRenderingContextHost::CreateCanvasResourceProvider2D, which

assumes the offscreen context has a placeholder canvas. Executing

this code path was triggering a failed DCHECK(HasPlaceholderCanvas()).

entry.title: Treat an empty variants list the same as absent variants list.
entry.content:
Currently, if a matrix compound suite does not specify a variants list

for a basic suite, then non-variant versions of the test get added to

the matrix compound suite. In contrast, a basic suite with an empty

variants list will not have any tests added, which makes the inclusion

of the basic suite in the matrix compound suite pointless. This CL

changes the behavior so that an empty variants list will result in

non-variant versions of the tests in the basic suite being added to the

matrix compound suite. There was a single instance of an empty variants

list, which has been removed to preserve the existing generated json

files.



Change-Id: Ib1146ece3fb0ca742fc7f9f82726dca16a92995e

entry.title: feedback: include cpu_arch key on Windows
entry.content:
This change mirrors crrev.com/c/2419120 which added a cpu_arch key on

OSX. This change adds a cpu_arch key so that feedback reports can

distinguish between x86, x64, and ARM64, and emulated (on ARM64) and

native.



The logic for determining the CPU string parallels crrev.com/c/4390754.



In addition to manual testing the updated unit test was also run with

unit_tests.exe --gtest_filter=Chrome*Log*.CpuTypePresentAndValid



TEST=Manual

On a Windows PC, navigate to chrome://system and check for a

"cpu_arch" key.

entry.title: Dynamically resolve IsEnclaveTypeSupported function.
entry.content:
It appears that, contrary to the documentation on MSDN,

IsEnclaveTypeSupported is not exported from all

versions of Windows 10 kernel32.dll - most certainly

10.0.10240 but also potentially others.



This causes a catastrophic DLL resolution failure during

bootstrap of the chrome.exe process.



This CL resolves this dependency dynamically so as to

correctly support these older operating systems.



BUG=1482250



Change-Id: I36efcb52ffd39a8edb8755833a7a0a4a5babe166

entry.title: device_settings_policy: Add device policy for switching function keys
entry.content:
This CL adds a new device policy called

"DeviceSwitchFunctionKeysBehaviorEnabled".



See c/p/r/t/p/M/DeviceSwitchFunctionKeysBehaviorEnabled.yaml in this

CL for a full definition of the policy.



About half of this CL adds the policy, following the instructions at

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/enterprise/add_new_policy.md.

The other half of this CL implements the policy, which controls the

behavior of the setting titled "Use the launcher key to change the

behavior of function keys".



Screenshots:

Policy true: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/twYSXaMb5a8kTTf

Policy false: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3HKJpTUuXKHLUUQ

Policy unset: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/B6ZjHXKeNEhfHPn



Test: ash_unittests -f=*InputDeviceSettingsPolicyHandlerTest*

Test: components_unittests -f="*ConfigurationPolicyHandlerListTest*"

Test: browser_tests -f *PolicyPrefsTest.PolicyToPrefsMapping*

Test: ash_unittests -f=*KeyboardPrefHandler*

Bug: b/296618643

entry.title: scanning: Replace mojo lite with webui
entry.content:
- Add 'mojo_webui_path' to ash/webui/common/mojo/BUILD.gn to allow

building a mojom-webui.js file for accessibility_features.mojom.

- Add copy_webui_mojo command and use in building scanning resources.

- Use mojom-webui for types in source and test files.

- Remove mojo-lite files from scanning app resources.

- This change also disables closure type checking for simplicity given

the TS migration CLs will land in quick succession of each other.



Bug: b:299520240

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter=*ScanApp*

Test: autoninja -C out/Default ash/webui/scanning/resources:closure_compile_module

Test: tast run $DUT scanapp.* excluding (hardware dependent tests)

entry.title: Pre-Paint: Enter childful but fragment item-less culled inline.
entry.content:
We missed it completely. The situation here was an AREA element with an

OOF child, so that the AREA element is a culled / special inline not

generating any fragment items, and the OOF child similarly doesn't

create any fragment items, and we'd miss the subtree completely.

entry.title: [dPWA] Move extensions_manager to WithAppResources
entry.content:
The ExtensionsManager is a resource that is only accessible via locks

that lock on AppIds based on current use-cases. As such, it should not

stay at the lock.h level, because then it can be accessed by locks

that do not lock on app Ids, like a NoopLock.

This CL fixes that by moving the manager to WithAppResources. If such a

resource is required to be accessed by a NoopLock, a new WithResource

class will need to be built.

entry.title: gpu: Make ContextProviderCommandBuffer delete on bound sequence
entry.content:
ContextProviderCommandBuffer has a hidden requirement that it should be

destroyed on the same sequence that it's bound to due to non-thread-safe

mojo::AssociatedReceiver client_receiver_ in

CommandBufferProxyImpl. This is true with or without locking enabled.



Make ContextProviderCommandBuffer delete on its bound sequence. It's not

possible to use RefCountedDeleteOnSequence for this since it requires

the task runner to be set at construction whereas we do it later via

BindToCurrentSequence.



Also includes minor cleanup in ContextProviderCommandBuffer sequence

checker, dchecks, etc. and makes it start from one ref count, fixing

call sites that use operator new instead of base::MakeRefCounted.



Bug: 1481757

Change-Id: I50c3fd5bab496ad54c1d850c71b70a52ace3b9aa

entry.title: compiler: use text section splitting for ChromeOS
entry.content:
In b/150866757, CWP folks asked to have text section splitting back, as

doing so would help us catch incorrectly optimized code. `lld` does not

split text sections by default, so a flag needs to be passed to enable

this functionality.



With this change applied, preliminary perf testing with speedometer2 - a

benchmark that's particularly sensitive to compiler optimization changes

- showed a low-confidence regression of 1% on an ARM board, and zero

perf difference on x86. If perf testing elsewhere demonstrates

higher-confidence regressions, this change can be reconsidered.



Bug: b:150866757

Change-Id: I3d5a25f7d146e9b61cd87640533e13fb2b56e00e

entry.title: [Remote Playback] Fix flaky test overflow-menu-keyboard-navigation.html
entry.content:
The overflow-menu-keyboard-navigation.html test verifies that the Cast

panel button is shown when there are available Cast devices. In the

test environment, we simulate devices by using the

`mediaPlayerRemoteRouteAvailabilityChanged` function to set the value of

`availability_` in RemotePlayback.



The recent CL crrev.com/c/4763371 makes RemotePlayback start listening

to availability change and updates the value of `availability_` when

the media metadata changes. As a result, tests are flaky because it's

possible that media metadata changes and overrides the value of

`availability_` that was previously set by tests.



This CL fixes the issue by introducing a flag in RemotePlayback. When

the flag is set to true, background availability monitoring is

disabled and `availability_` won't be changed.

entry.title: wallpaper: daily refresh timing issue
entry.content:
There are 2 factors the contribute to this issue:

1. After daily wallpaper is updated, we call

`OnDailyRefreshWallpaperUpdated() to update the check times for daily

refresh. These updated check times consequently tell

`WallpaperDailyRefreshScheduler` to refresh its internal pref state,

and this can trigger an immediate `OnCheckpointChanged()`, which is a

signal for our daily refresh check.

2. Wallpaper info is updated after the callback is run.



Combining 1. and 2., we sometimes run into a scenario where we check for

an already updated daily wallpaper but with a previous wallpaper info.

Consequently, causing an unnecessary new wallpaper update.



To address this issue, this CL opts to temporarily pause observing the

daily refresh scheduler, and resume when the wallpaper info is updated.



BUG=b:299957857

TEST=ash_unittest --gtest_filter="WallpaperControllerTest.*"



Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chrome.try:linux-chromeos-chrome

entry.title: Do not hang the renderer if attempting to open document pip window from about:blank URL
entry.content:
When a parent window opens an about:blank window, the new window will inherit its document URL from the parent window while the URL in the omnibox shows "about:blank". This means that the renderer code in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4595397 fails to detect that the URL in the omnibox is about:blank and cause the code to reach https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4746980 without a compromised renderer. This will cause the browser to report bad_message and instruct the renderer to hang, which doesn't have any security implications but it isn't nice.



Unfortunately, AFAICT, there isn't a way to detect the exact URL (whether it is about:blank or not) in the omnibox from the renderer. Therefore, change the browser-side code such that attempting to open document pip windows from such URLs doesn't hang the renderer.



Fixed: 1460025



Change-Id: I355bcfbc8ba791f73645cdcc4e546186706e199f

entry.title: Fenced frames: Fix reportEvent crash due to different Fenced Frames
entry.content:
properties getter implementations.



See the comment of the added test

"GetFencedFramePropertiesShouldTravseFrameTree" in

fenced_frame_browsertest.cc for a detailed explanation of the crash.



The TLDR is the FencedFrameProperties used at browser side v.s.

renderer side are different. They may end up with different result in

some cases. For example, to reproduce, see below 3 layers of nested

frames, from top to bottom:



- Fenced frame.

- Urn iframe.

- iframe.



At browser, the iframe's navigation request gets the fenced frame's

FencedFrameProperties. Because at browser side the getter does not do

a tree traversal.



At renderer, during reportEvent call, the iframe gets the urn iframe's

FencedFrameProperties. Because at renderer side the getter does a tree

traversal.



The correct semantics here should be doing a tree traversal. The reason

is in this case an urn iframe should acting as if it is a fenced frame.



The CL

1. changed `FrameTreeNode::GetFencedFrameProperties()` to do tree

traversal by default, except for partition nonce. In a FF frame tree,

all frames should operate on the root FF's partition nonce.

2. made sure browser and renderer side calls for the getter both do a

tree traversal to fix this crash.



Also added test cases to verify the change does not regress partition nonce:

1. An urn iframe nested in a fenced frame should operate on the fenced

frame's partition nonce.

2. In the above test, if there is an additional regular iframe nested

under the urn iframe, it should also operate on the fenced frame's

partition nonce.



For ClientHintsExtendedData and permission policy related usage of

FencedFrameProperties getter, both call sites are calling the getter

inside after checking the node is a fenced frame root node. In this

case it has no difference whether to do a tree traversal or not. The

FencedFrameProperties of the fenced frame node itself is returned.

Plus client hints are disabled for now. Added TODO that future tests

should cover cases similar to above.



In long term, urn iframe support will be deprecated. This will make

the algorithm much simpler. This parameter to the getter can be

removed entirely then.



Bug: 1470634

Change-Id: Ibdc56dd8263a1cee129afd14631113ec4b9f556d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4775457

Reviewed-by: Rakina Zata Amni

entry.title: media: Resolve secure handles to FDs and submit into V4L2 for H264
entry.content:
This is the last piece in piping the actual secure buffers used for

decryption into V4L2 so it can decode them for secure playback.



A similar model will be used for the other codecs later when

implemented.



The decoder takes the secure handle from the DecoderBuffer and holds

onto it. It then passes that handle into the accelerator so it can go

into the platform specific implementation (i.e. V4L2). We then resolve

the secure handle back to the proper V4L2Buffer that we originally

acquired that handle from. The fd for that V4L2Buffer is then submitted

as the source of the secure decrypted data into V4L2.



Secure handles are just identifiers; the actual resource management of

the buffer is done in the V4L2Buffer class itself.



BUG=b:248610914

TEST=Secure playback works w/ full prototype on cherry

entry.title: ARC tracing: fix DCHECK fail activating sep window
entry.content:
Fix a DCHECK failure that occurs as a result of activating a window from

an observer which is called in response to activation of a different

window. This would have happened whenever activating a window while a

entry.title: Revert "[PGO] Use Android PGO profiles for Android build."
entry.content:
This reverts commit c52edf6ded119daf6cc0ccb2d868fa650ed3fcdd.



Reason for revert: Per crbug.com/1464107#19, Android profiles might not be ready yet.



Original change's description:

> [PGO] Use Android PGO profiles for Android build.

>

> This CL performs part (3) of crrev.com/c/4722865: Start using Android

> PGO profiles to build Chrome on Android. Experiments show that the build

> has similar Speedometer 2 as before (using mac-arm builds). It's

> somewhat disappointing that the results weren't better, but at least

> it's no worse, and makes it easier to do future experiments.

>
